title: To Kill a Mockingbird
description: A novel about the serious issues of rape and racial inequality, narrated by a young girl named Scout Finch in the Deep South during the 1930s.
A dystopian novel set in a totalitarian society ruled by the Party and its leader, Big Brother, exploring themes of surveillance, censorship, and individuality.

title: Pride and Prejudice
description: A romantic novel that critiques the British landed gentry at the end of the 18th century, focusing on the turbulent relationship between Elizabeth Bennet and Mr. Darcy.

title: The Great Gatsby
description: A novel about the American dream and the disillusionment of the Jazz Age, centered around the mysterious millionaire Jay Gatsby and his obsession with Daisy Buchanan.

title: Moby-Dick
description: A novel about the obsessive quest of Captain Ahab for revenge against Moby Dick, the giant white sperm whale that bit off his leg.

title: Crime and Punishment
description: A psychological thriller that follows the moral dilemmas of Raskolnikov, a former student who believes he is above the law and commits murder.

title: The Brothers Karamazov
description: A philosophical novel that explores deep questions of faith, morality, and free will through the lives of the Karamazov brothers.

title: Brave New World
description: A dystopian novel that presents a future society driven by technological advancements, consumerism, and the suppression of individuality.

title: Jane Eyre
description: A novel that follows the life of an orphaned girl, Jane Eyre, as she overcomes hardships and finds love and independence.

title: Wuthering Heights
description: A tale of passion and revenge set on the Yorkshire moors, focusing on the tumultuous relationship between Heathcliff and Catherine Earnshaw.

title: Great Expectations
description: A coming-of-age story that follows the life of Pip, an orphan who dreams of becoming a gentleman and navigating the complexities of wealth and class.

title: Little Women
description: A novel that follows the lives of the four March sisters as they grow up during the Civil War, exploring themes of family, love, and personal ambition.

title: The Odyssey
description: An epic poem attributed to Homer, detailing the adventures of Odysseus as he attempts to return home after the Trojan War.

title: The Iliad
description: An ancient Greek epic poem by Homer, set during the Trojan War, focusing on the hero Achilles and his conflict with Agamemnon.

title: The Count of Monte Cristo
description: A tale of an innocent man wrongfully imprisoned who seeks revenge against those who betrayed him, exploring themes of justice and redemption.

title: Anna Karenina
description: A tragic love story that explores the life of Anna Karenina, a married woman who falls in love with Count Vronsky, set against the backdrop of Russian society.

title: Dracula
description: A Gothic horror novel that tells the story of Count Dracula's attempt to move from Transylvania to England, and the battle between him and a group of people led by Professor Van Helsing.

title: Frankenstein
description: A novel about Victor Frankenstein, a scientist who creates a sentient creature in an unorthodox experiment, exploring themes of ambition, isolation, and the quest for knowledge.

title: The Picture of Dorian Gray
description: A philosophical novel that tells the story of Dorian Gray, a young man whose portrait ages while he remains young and beautiful, exploring themes of vanity and moral corruption.

title: Fahrenheit 451
description: A dystopian novel that presents a future where books are banned and 'firemen' burn any that are found, exploring themes of censorship and the power of knowledge.

title: The Sun Also Rises
description: A novel about a group of American and British expatriates in 1920s Paris, exploring themes of love, loss, and the disillusionment of the Lost Generation.

title: Slaughterhouse-Five
description: A satirical novel that follows the life of Billy Pilgrim, who becomes 'unstuck in time' and experiences different moments of his life, including his time as a soldier in World War II.

title: One Hundred Years of Solitude
description: A multi-generational story that follows the Buendía family in the fictional town of Macondo, exploring themes of magic realism and the cyclical nature of history.

title: Don Quixote
description: A novel that follows the adventures of an aging nobleman who becomes a self-declared knight-errant, exploring themes of reality versus illusion.

title: The Metamorphosis
description: A novella that tells the story of Gregor Samsa, who wakes up one morning to find himself transformed into a giant insect, exploring themes of alienation and identity.

title: The Alchemist
description: A philosophical novel about a shepherd named Santiago who dreams of finding treasure in Egypt, exploring themes of destiny and personal legend.

title: The Kite Runner
description: A story of friendship and redemption set against the backdrop of Afghanistan's tumultuous history, focusing on Amir's guilt over betraying his childhood friend Hassan.

title: The Handmaid's Tale
description: A dystopian novel set in a totalitarian society where women are subjugated, following Offred, a handmaid forced into reproductive servitude.

title: The Road
description: A post-apocalyptic novel that follows a father and son as they journey through a desolate landscape, struggling to survive while clinging to hope.

title: Life of Pi
description: A survival story about Pi Patel, a boy stranded on a lifeboat with a Bengal tiger, blending adventure with philosophical musings on faith and storytelling.

title: The Da Vinci Code
description: A thriller that follows symbologist Robert Langdon as he unravels clues tied to Leonardo da Vinci’s art, uncovering a conspiracy about the Holy Grail.

title: The Hunger Games
description: A dystopian saga where Katniss Everdeen volunteers for a televised death match to save her sister, critiquing authoritarianism and class inequality.

title: The Night Circus
description: A magical realism tale about two illusionists bound to a mystical competition within a wandering circus, blurring the lines between reality and fantasy.

title: Educated
description: A memoir of Tara Westover’s journey from a survivalist Idaho family with no formal education to earning a PhD from Cambridge University.

title: The Hobbit
description: A fantasy novel following Bilbo Baggins on an unexpected adventure filled with dwarves, treasure, and epic quests.

title: A Tale of Two Cities
description: A historical novel set in London and Paris before and during the French Revolution, exploring themes of resurrection and sacrifice.

title: Catch-22
description: A satirical war novel that follows Captain John Yossarian and his squadron during World War II, highlighting the absurdity of bureaucracy.

title: The Grapes of Wrath
description: A novel depicting the hardships of American farmers during the Great Depression as they migrate west in search of a better life.

title: Beloved
description: A haunting novel about a former slave haunted by the memories of her past and the ghost of her dead child.

title: Invisible Man
description: A novel that explores the social and intellectual challenges faced by African Americans, following an unnamed protagonist's quest for identity and recognition.

title: A Clockwork Orange
description: A dystopian novel that follows a young delinquent's journey through a futuristic society, examining themes of free will and state control.

title: The Stranger
description: A novel that follows Meursault, an emotionally detached man, as he navigates a senseless world, prompting profound questions about existence.

title: Lolita
description: A controversial novel that tells the story of Humbert Humbert and his disturbing obsession, exploring themes of desire and manipulation.

title: Rebecca
description: A gothic novel about a young bride who finds herself overshadowed by the memory of her husband's first wife in a mysterious mansion.
